meanings.definition: Omit or neglect to do something.
meanings.sent1: She kept pretermitting her homework assignments, causing her grades to drop.
meanings.sent2: The teacher warned the students not to pretermitting their responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful wizard ended up pretermitting his spell practice, leading to comical mishaps.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's decision to pretermitting the safety protocols was a risky move.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of pretermitting your health can be severe.

meanings.sent1: He had a habit of pretermitting the small details in his work.
meanings.sent2: The manager chose to pretermitting the complaints of the dissatisfied customers.
meanings.sent3: The detective couldn't help but pretermitting the crucial piece of evidence right in front of him.
meanings.sent4: The artist deliberately pretermitting the traditional techniques to create a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring the warning signs, he continued pretermitting the signs of trouble ahead.
